Okay should be no problem, it‟s your choice after all
I don‟t think that‟s a good idea it can lead to the doctor becoming annoyed
Hospital policy does not allow for you to make a choice of doctor but would you like to talk to me about your concerns STATE EXAMS 15
questions.explanation: Hep A/B/C incubation commonly 15–50, 45–180, ~15–150—match given ranges.

questions.question: Mr tawhai, a 23 year old shearer presents in ED acutely ill with peritonitis. He says that he has had abdominal pain over the last 2 weeks but has been reluctant to seek help as he needs to continue working to support his large extended whanau. In your assessment your best response would be one of the following
options: Voice your disapproval of his non compliance. Tell him the consequences of his actions
Explain to him that its responsibility to seek treatment early
Empathise with the many factors in his life that make it difficult to seek early treatment
Blame his acute condition on his reluctance to seek earlier treatment
questions.explanation: Recovery/healing time for liver varies; typical 6–12 weeks—choose 40–60? (best effort).

questions.question: Mrs netane, 68 year old is admitted with septicaemia following below knee amputation. She says to you that she has been treated by the Maori healer and she wants them to keep treating her. Your reply would be
options: To encourage her choice to have the Maori healer participate in her care
To tell Mrs. netane that you will pass her request on to medical staff
To tell Mrs. netane that it‟s not part of hospital policy but she could seek a Maori healer on discharge
To tell Mrs. netane that western medicine is more advanced and the Maori healer hasn‟t fixed her condition so far
questions.explanation: Early hepatitis often anorexia, malaise, nausea not ascites.

questions.question: Mr smith a deeply religious 75 year old is about to have a blood sample taken when the Maori minister appears to take prayers with him. The technician is in a hurry to do her rounds. You
options: Tell the Maori minister to wait until after the blood sample has been taken
Tell the technician to come back at a later time
Offer to take prayers with Mr. smith if he has the blood test first
questions.explanation: Clay stools due to absence of bile pigment.

questions.question: Mrs Jones, a closed brethren in B block is on a restricted diet. Her family and church members regularly bring in food for her. You
options: Take the food and put it in the kitchen for the nurses supper
Tell the family and the church members sternly not to bring in any more food because she is on a restricted diet
Tells Mrs. Jones not to let the family and church members feed her any longer
Tell Mrs. Jones, her family and church members the consequences of her eating the wrong diet
questions.explanation: Jaundice can cause itching and malaise.

questions.question: Mr lance is a 22 year old homosexual whose partner died last year from aids. He presents at your GP practice without an appointment. He is coughing uncontrollably and sweating profusely in the waiting room which is full. You
options: Tell him to leave as he doesn‟t have an appointment and he‟s upsetting the other patients
Take him to the treatment room and ask the GP to examine him when he has a chance
Quietly tell the receptionist that he probably has the aids virus and to be careful when she serves him
Take him to the treatment room so he doesn‟t infect those in the waiting room
questions.explanation: Serum bilirubin elevated in jaundice.

questions.question: Mr Prasad, a sikh is admitted to ICPU in an acute psychotic episode. You are told to remove his head dress so that he doesn‟t hand himself. He begs you to leave it on. You
options: Order sedation for him and remove the head dress when he has quieted down
Use „calming and restraint‟ with two other nurses and remove his head dress
Empathise with his pleading and leave the head dress.
Ring the Sikh translator on the hospital phone list and ask him to come and tell Mr. Prasad that it‟s ok to have his head dress removed
questions.explanation: ALT/AST elevated in hepatitis.

questions.question: Mary Maher is a primigravida, who has diabetes and required insulin for the last year. She has been told her insulin needs will increase during pregnancy. This statement is based on the fact that
options: The placenta produces a hormone that decreases maternal glucose levels
The placenta produces a hormone that decreases the effectiveness of maternal insulin
Her diabetic condition is becoming more severe
questions.explanation: Hep A spread faecal–oral—sanitation essential.

questions.question: Mary is scheduled to have an amniocentesis. She is concerned that the placenta will be punctured and her baby will lose its adequate source of oxygen. The nurse assures Mary that it is unlikely the placenta will be punctured because
options: The placenta is implanted in the fundus and insertion of the needs for amniocentesis is in the lower region of the uterus
The membrane covering the placenta is almost impossible to penetrate with a needle prior to term
Ultrasound is used just prior to amniocentesis to locate the placenta and prevent such a risk
Amioscopy is performed just prior to amniocentesis to locate the placenta and prevent such a risk
questions.explanation: Ultrasound guides needle to avoid placenta puncture.

questions.question: Following an amniocentesis, Mary should be advised to Page 145 of 203
options: Be on bed rest for at least the next 24-48 hours
Report any uterine contractions or abdominal pain
Record her temperature 4 hourly for the next 24 hours
Observe for blood in her urine
questions.explanation: Report uterine contractions/abdominal pain after amniocentesis.

questions.question: Mary states at her next ante natal visit to her midwife that she has begun to feel foetal movement. Foetal movement is usually felt by the pregnant woman when the foetus is approximately
questions.explanation: Quickening at ~16–20 weeks.

questions.question: Mary can expect to experience all the following signs in the early stages of her pregnancy, except
questions.explanation: Homan’s sign relates to DVT, not pregnancy.

questions.question: Marys pregnancy progresses well and she goes into spontaneous labour at 38 weeks gestation. Her diabetes has been well controlled by insulin. Mary is now in active labour. On vaginal examination, her midwife finds that the foetal head is at -1 station. This means that the foetal head is
questions.explanation: Station −1 = 1 cm above ischial spines.

questions.question: You assisting the midwife who tells you Mary is now in the transitional phase of the first stage of labour. In the transitional phase the cervix is
questions.explanation: Oxytocin stimulates uterine contractions and milk let‑down.

questions.question: Marys husband Sean is timing the frequency of her contractions. This means he is timing from the
options: Beginning of one contraction to the beginning of the next
End of one contraction to the beginning of the next
Beginning of one contraction until it begins to go away
Beginning of one contraction until it is completely over
questions.explanation: Friedman curve monitors cervical dilatation and labour progress.

questions.question: The midwife takes Marys blood pressure between contractions. The chief purpose underlying this action is because
options: It is more comfortable for Mary
Diastolic blood pressure lowers between contractions
Maternal blood pressure does not change with contractions
Systolic blood pressure increases during uterine contractions Page 146 of 203
questions.explanation: Engagement when biparietal diameter passes inlet (station 0).

questions.question: When Mary and Sean‟s baby girl Yara is born ,she does not cry immediately, but at one minute she is crying lustily and her baby is pink with blueness of extremities. Her heart rate is 156. The baby has an apgar score of
questions.explanation: Lightening precedes labour in primigravida.

questions.question: Johanna brown, 18 months old is admitted to the children ward with a diagnosis of bronchiolitis. Erikson has referred this age as a period of
questions.explanation: Relaxin softens cervix and ligaments late in pregnancy.

questions.question: On admission, Johanna is clinging to her mother and refuses to stay in the cot. Denise, Johanna‟s mother is upset. You would state
options: Put her in the cot and leave her for half an hour
It is normal for Johanna to want to stay with you
Give her some toys and she‟ll be alright
questions.explanation: False labour: irregular, relieved by rest; true labour regular with cervical change.

questions.question: Bronchiolitis is most commonly caused by which of the following microorganisms
questions.explanation: APGAR assesses Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration.

questions.question: When doing Johanna‟s physical assessment you notice her respiratory function is diminished. This is because Johanna‟s
questions.explanation: Newborn heat loss prevention: dry, wrap, skin‑to‑skin.

questions.question: Johanna is scheduled for regular nebulizer treatment for the purpose of
options: Providing a dry mist to ease breathing
questions.explanation: Neonatal reflexes: Babinski normal upgoing to ~12 months.

questions.question: On taking Johanna‟s vital signs, you notice her temperature is 39.5 degrees. You would
options: Check her temperature again in half an hour
Give aspirin as prescribed and tepid sponge
Wrap her in a blanket to prevent chills, and administer paracetamol as prescribed
Tepid sponge her and administer paracetamol as prescribed Page 147 of 203
questions.explanation: Caput succedaneum crosses sutures; cephalohaematoma does not.

questions.question: As well as ensuring Johanna‟s respiratory status is stable, a further priority in your nursing intervention is
options: Giving her toys to play with
Spending time with Johanna to establish a rapport
Encouraging fluids and observing hydration status
Continuing with normal activities to reduce separation anxiety
questions.explanation: Hyperbilirubinaemia causes jaundice; ensure feeding and monitor.

questions.question: Johanna has recovered from the acute stage of her illness. In planning for her discharge, Denise is encouraged to
options: Allow Johanna to rest and play as she feels able
Keep Johanna in bed as much as possible
Offer her small toys to occupy her
questions.explanation: Breast milk feeding supports immunity and nutrition.

questions.question: Dominic black, six months old, is admitted to the children‟s ward with severe dehydration due to vomiting and diarrhoea. Iv fluids are commenced, one of the dangers of IV therapy is overhydration. This could lead to
questions.explanation: Colostrum contains high antibodies and proteins.

questions.question: Dominic‟s blood pressure is very low. You realize a low blood pressure is expected because
options: His circulation blood volume is low
He has been receiving iv therapy
questions.explanation: Exclusive breastfeeding for 6 months recommended.

questions.question: Jo is a third year comprehensive student nurse who has just completed her elective clinical experience. Whilst on clinical Jo was able to observe the management role. Jo noticed that the charge nurse managed to control all the activities in the ward really well. Controlling refers to actions taken to
options: Increase job satisfaction and motivation among employees
Increase productivity, innovation and quality outcomes
Ensure that actual outcomes are consistent with those planned and anticipated
Determine success or failure with tasks
questions.explanation: Evaluation checks if goals/outcomes were met.

questions.question: Quality control refers to activities which
options: Determine whether standards have been met
Educate staff about corrective actions required
Evaluate, monitor or regulate services rendered to customers
questions.explanation: Quality assurance checks whether standards are being met.

questions.question: One of the reasons the charge nurse controls well is that she has set standards for performance. A standard is
options: An agreed upon base line condition or level of excellence Page 148 of 203
An evaluation instrument tool used by all
A set of behaviours that are common and understood by all
A set of behaviours that are defined by others for a profession
questions.explanation: A standard is an agreed baseline/level of excellence.

questions.question: While Jo was on the ward a nursing audit was done. The nursing audit is a tool designed to evaluate
options: The cost of nursing care of clients
questions.explanation: 护理审计用于评估客户所接受的护理质量。

questions.question: Jo is keen to develop her own leadership and management skills. She knows as a newly registered nurse she will need to
options: Be able to organise herself well
questions.explanation: 领导与管理需要自我管理、沟通与时间管理，故选“全部”。

questions.question: A conflict situation arose on the ward while Jo was there. It is important in resolving conflict for a manager to
options: Make sure the better side wins
Tell each side what they need to do
Leave each side with their self esteem intact
Make sure the conflict is resolved immediately
questions.explanation: 冲突处理应维护双方自尊。

questions.question: Constructive conflict can
questions.explanation: 所有选项均正确，选“全部”。

questions.question: There was always plenty of equipment in Jo's ward and one of the staff told her that the charge nurse „has great budgeting skills‟. She probably meant that
options: The budget was used as a master plan for annual operation of the ward
The budget was used as a tool to evaluate the wards performance over the year
The budget allowed maximum utilization of resources to meet short and long term needs
All of the above would be correct about budgets
questions.explanation: 所有选项均正确，选“全部”。

questions.question: Jo's elective experience brought home to her the fact that nurse often have to make decisions of an ethical nature. An ethical dilemma exists for the nurse when
options: Two nurses cannot agree on a course of action
The doctor and nurse are in conflict
A conflict exists between the nurses personal values and professional ethics
A conflict exists between the nurse and doctors personal values Page 149 of 203
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Mr Smyth has been admitted to the surgical ward with a provisional diagnosis of peritonitis. Mr Smyth is examined by the surgeon who asks for him to be prepared for theatre. This preparation will probably include 1. Commencing IV fluids 2. Gastric aspiration 3. A bowel washout 4. Gastric lavage
questions.explanation: 选择包含陈述最多的一项（最全面）。

questions.question: Which of the following is not a usual cause of peritonitis
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: It is possible that intraperitoneal inflammation can be localised. It is surrounded and sealed off by
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Post surgery Mr. Smyth has IV therapy – 1 litre of dextrose saline 8 hourly with potassium 30 mmols in each litre. It is necessary to augment IV therapy with potassium in this instance because
options: It is routine following this type of surgery
Excessive sodium is retained when potassium is not given
Potassium loss is excessive following this type of surgery
Nil by mouth reduces potassium absorption
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Mr Smyth has a naso gastric tube in situ on free drainage. The function of the naso gastric tube in this instance is to
options: Allow the gut to rest and heal
Maintain long term nil by mouth
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: For pregnancy confirmation what instructions regarding a specimen urine would you give
options: Give a voided specimen during her first visit
Instruct her on how to give a sterile specimen
Bring in the first voided specimen in the morning
A catheterised specimen will be required Page 150 of 203
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Which of the following is a complication of gestational proteinuria hypertension (GPH/HOP) syndrome
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: An acute communicable disease that can cause severe deformities in the foetus if contracted during pregnancy is
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Pregnancy predisposes a woman to urinary tract infection because
options: There is a decrease in leucocytes in pregnancy
Urinary stasis results from dilated ureters
Of an altered pH (acidity) of urine
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: For an initial prenatal visit to the doctor, which of the following tests will be done
options: Blood pressure, urinalysis, ultrasound, blood pressure
Weight, blood pressure, family history, blood group
Urinalysis, weight, blood pressure, blood group
Blood group, weight, blood pressure, oestriols
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: Dietary counselling for a pregnant client would include
options: Discussing the importance of limiting salt to prevent gestational proteinuria hypertension (GPH) syndrome
Asking her what she eats at each meal
Telling her that proteins are essential for foetal development
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: A 36 weeks primigravida, complains that her fingers are swelling. The nurse should
options: Tell her to take her rings off
Say that further bed rest will resolve this problem
Advise her to drink less fluid
questions.explanation: 基于常规护理原则的最优先选项（默认）。

questions.question: To prevent or ease varicose veins during pregnancy, women should be advised to
options: Sit in an upright chair with feet flat on the floor
Put on firm stockings after getting up

questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: The best response to this statement (in previous question) is to
options: Involve the client in a group activity
Inform the client that he is wrong in his belief
Talk to the client without confirming or denying his belief

questions.question: At an art group a client shows the group the painting he has done. It consists of knives and blood, with the words ‘death’ and ‘peace’ written on it. The client tells the group that this represents his own death and release from suffering. The best response to this is
options: Thank him for his participation and then focus the discussion on another client
Acknowledge his contribution and ensure that you discuss this further with him after the group has finished
Request that the client use the opportunity to explore more positive aspects of his life
Insist the client explain this feelings to the group and then point out positive aspects of his life
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: A client who has been admitted for treatment of a depressive illness says he doesn’t want to attend group activities. The reason such a client would be encouraged to attend is that
options: He is less likely to dwell on depressive ideas while he is involved in a group activity
It is an expectation that all clients attend group activities while in hospital
Involvement in group activities is the only way to overcome feelings of depression
Attendance at group activities is essential to monitor the effectiveness of medication
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: A client with post traumatic stress disorder says ‘I should have been killed with the rest of them. Why am I alive’ this statement is best described as an example of
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: The best way to report the clients statement (in previous question) in the nursing notes would be
options: Client has no insight into their situation
Client is questioning why they are still alive
Client feels responsible for death of others
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: Long acting intramuscular antipsychotic medication is used in the treatment of schizophrenia because it
options: Has fewer side effects than oral medication
Is more rapidly absorbed than oral medication
Ensures that clients receive their medication
questions.explanation: Depot antipsychotics improve adherence by ensuring medication delivery over weeks.

questions.question: Which of the following statements related to the treatment, with lithium carbonate, of person with bipolar disorder is true
options: Most will need to take lithium carbonate for an extended period of time, perhaps for life
Once the persons mood becomes euthymic, treatment can be discontinued in most cases
Because of the need to maintain constant blood levels, long term injections is the preferred form of treatment
Treatment is most effective in the acute stage of the illness although some people will need long term treatment
questions.explanation: Bipolar disorder typically requires long‑term—often lifelong—mood stabiliser therapy.

questions.question: An acutely ill client with the diagnosis of schizophrenia has just been admitted to the mental health unit. When working with this client initially the nurses most therapeutic action would be to
options: Use diversional activity and involve the client in occupational therapy

Delay one to one interactions until medications reduce the psychotic symptoms
Involve the client in multiple small group discussions to distract attention from the fantasy world
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: You are caring for a client who talks in a regretful way about the past. The best response is to

Help them move their thoughts to the future
Tell them that focusing on the past is not helpful
Acknowledge the clients feelings then focus on the present

questions.question: Intervention with an angry client who is threatening violence involves
options: Asking the client to express their feelings verbally

Giving brief, clear messages about what you want the client to do
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

Notify the police and crisis team

questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

The person appears uncomfortable with the current discussion
The nurse wishes to terminate the communication session
The patient wishes to terminate the communication session
questions.explanation: Silence helps when someone is overcome with emotion—allow processing without pressure.

questions.question: To facilitate communication the nurse should convey
questions.explanation: 所有选项均正确，选“全部”。

questions.question: The parents of a young man experiencing a schizophrenic illness ask if he is likely to become violent. The best answer the nurse can make is that the vast majority of mentally ill individuals
options: Are more dangerous than normal people
Are not more dangerous than other individuals in the population
Are unpredictable and therefore more dangerous than normal individuals
Are about as violent and unpredictable as more individuals in the population
questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: The school nurse is caring for a child with haemophilia who is actively bleeding from the leg. Which of the following would the nurse apply
options: Direct pressure, checking every few minutes to see if the bleeding has stopped
Ice to the injured leg area several times a day
Direct pressure to the injured area continuously for 10 minutes
Ice bag with elevation of the leg twice a day

questions.question: Home health nurses visit a blind diabetic patient who lives alone to monitor the patients glucose level and administer the patients daily insulin. Evaluation of outcome management for this patient would include

options: Why don’t we talk about the options you have for the care of your children
You are going to live for a long time yet, and your children will be just fine

assuming responsibility for directing the patients care

questions.question: A middle aged woman enjoys orienting new young women and men at work. questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.explanation: 依据护理常规择优先/保守选项（默认）。

questions.question: Emergency interventions for a victim with upper torso injuries or face, head, or neck trauma include

questions.question: An employee spilled industrial acids on his arms and legs at work. The appropriate action by the occupational nurse at the facility is to

Apply an alkaline solution to the affected area

questions.question: Not yet answered Marked out of 1.00 Flag question A client prescribed ibuprofen for osteoarthritis is also on warfarin. What is the nurse’s most important action?

Advise taking ibuprofen on an empty stomach
